name: ginsenosidase type IV
classes: Glycosidases, i.e. enzymes that hydrolyse O- and S-glycosyl compounds
reaction: a protopanaxatriol-type ginsenoside with two glycosyl residues at position 6 + 2 H2O = a protopanaxatriol-type ginsenoside with no glycosidic modification at position 6 + D-glucopyranose + a monosaccharide (overall reaction); (1a) a protopanaxatriol-type ginsenoside with two glycosyl residues at position 6 + H2O = a protopanaxatriol-type ginsenoside with a single glucosyl at position 6 + a monosaccharide; (1b) a protopanaxatriol-type ginsenoside with a single glucosyl at position 6 + H2O = a protopanaxatriol-type ginsenoside with no glycosidic modification at position 6 + D-glucopyranose
substrates: protopanaxatriol-type ginsenoside with two glycosyl residues at position 6
protopanaxatriol-type ginsenoside with a single glucosyl at position 6
products: protopanaxatriol-type ginsenoside with no glycosidic modification at position 6
protopanaxatriol-type ginsenoside with a single glucosyl at position 6
comment: Ginsenosidase type IV catalyses the sequential hydrolysis of the 6-O-beta-D-(1->2)-glycosidic bond or the 6-O-alpha-D-(1->2)-glycosidic bond in protopanaxatriol-type ginsenosides with a disacchride attached to the C6 position, followed by the hydrolysis of the remaining 6-O-beta-D-glycosidic bond (e.g. ginsenoside Re -> ginsenoside Rg1 -> ginsenoside F1).

references.title: A novel ginsenosidase from an Aspergillus strain hydrolyzing 6-O-multi-glycosides of protopanaxatriol-type ginsenosides, named ginsenosidase type IV.
Enzyme kinetics of ginsenosidase type IV hydrolyzing 6-O-multi-glycosides of protopanaxatriol type ginsenosides.
